question: What are the core pillars of Data Cloud capabilities

options.option: Connect, Harmonize, Unify, Analyze and Predict, and Act

question: Which are benefits of using data spaces? Choose two.

options.option: Manage user access to designated data spaces using permission sets.
Ensures your data doesn't cross regional boundaries.
Segregate your data, metadata, and processes by brand, region, or department.

question: Which of these are valid use cases for Data Cloud's capabilities? Choose three.

options.option: Gain insights on data streams in real time and trigger follow-up actions.
Build complex segments of unified individuals with related data from multiple platforms.
Design, deploy, and deliver campaigns to any region with true 1:1 content recommendations.
Aggregate data from multiple systems to understand a customer's true lifetime value across multiple accounts and devices.
Build simple segments of hierarchical identities with disparate data from one legacy system.

question: Which of these are key differentiators of Salesforce Data Cloud? Choose three.

options.option: Replaces the need to manage data anywhere else in your organization
User-friendly interface and built on Lightning
Focuses primarily on the financial services industry data
Integrates easily with Salesforce products and AppExchange

question: What does "Connect" mean as a capability?

options.option: Identify and match individuals to create a unified profile.
Create smart segments and activate them anywhere.
Embed data with intelligence and make it available to analytics systems.
Synchronize data from Salesforce and external data sources and transform data when needed.

question: Which statements are true of Data Cloud platform functionality? Choose three.

options.option: It's an open platform that allows you to integrate external systems and data sources.
Data is only ingested in batches.
Data is transformed, cleaned, and harmonized into the standard data model.
Data storage has a maximum threshold.
Data can be activated in Sales Cloud, Marketing Cloud Engagement, Service Cloud, and other Salesforce clouds.

question: What does "Unify" mean as a capability of Data Cloud?

options.option: Consume or activate data to any cloud and any application.
Connect, match, and reconcile customer data.
Create smart segments and activate them anywhere.
Embed data with intelligence and make it available to analytics systems.

question: Which are data ethics best practices? Choose three.

options.option: Collect and use only what you need.
Collect large amounts of data and determine how to use it later.

options.option: Complete a thorough data discovery phase.

question: Data modeling occurs after which step when establishing the data model in the Data Cloud platform?

Assess how data should be normalized, Map to the data model, Create an inventory of all data streams, Configure the DMO relationships of the data model.

options.option: Transpose the single records to multiple records

options.option: Include many attributes and contact points.
Avoid using match rules with Individual Attributes and contact points, since this is not a recommended practice.

Ensure names are included into the rules.

question: The unification process recognizes and matches data belonging to individual humans. Which of the following is the end result of this process?

options.option: The matched data appears as records mapped to Individual Data Model Objects (DMO).
This data produces a map allowing your organization to pinpoint all its customers' locations.
This data produces a map allowing your organization to pinpoint all its customers' locations at any given point in time.
The matched data creates within Marketing Cloud a separate object for each piece of data from customers.

question: Which match rules are available to link multiple records into a unified customer profile? Choose three.

options.option: They establish criteria for relating source Individual records to each other.
They produce a record called Unified Individual.
They make use of most standard and custom attributes mapped to the data model.
They can only be used with standard attributes mapped to the data model.

question: Which of the following are true of anonymous profiles? Choose two.

options.option: Once at least one known individual profile is matched with an anonymous record, that record will be marked as known going forward.
A source profile without the Is Anonymous field mapped on the Individual DMO is always considered anonymous.
For anonymous profiles to be counted correctly, the value of the Is Anonymous field must be set to 0.
They're excluded from the known profile utilization consumption.

question: Complete this statement: Cloud File Storage Activation Target lets you publish segments ____

options.option: directly from Data Cloud to Marketing Cloud Business Units.
so Salesforce Core apps can query.

question: Which are Activation best practices? Choose two.

options.option: If you have data from multiple data sources in Data Cloud, default to using the Unified Individual as the Activation Membership.
Always share your data with a third-party partner.

question: What is the difference between filtering in a segment and an activation?

options.option: In a segment, filters narrow your audience. In an activation, filters narrow down relevant values with related attributes that personalize messages.
In an activation, filters broaden your audience. In a segment, filters provide more relevant values with related attributes that personalize messages.
In an activation, filters narrow your audience. In a segment, filters narrow down relevant values with related attributes that personalize messages.
In a segment, filters narrow your audience. In an activation, filters broaden relevant values with related attributes that personalize messages.

question: Put the steps to access Data Cloud data from a third-party partner in the correct order.

options.option: Build your data shares, Plan your data strategy, View your Data Cloud objects from the third-party partner, Create data share targets and set connectivity with the third-party partner, Set up your credentials, Link your data share with your data share target.

Plan your data strategy, Create data share targets and set connectivity with the third-party partner, Set up your credentials, View your Data Cloud objects from the third-party partner, Link your data share with your data share target, Build your data shares.

options.explanation: A data lake uses all types of enterprise data for tasks such as reporting, visualization, analytics, and machine learning.

question: Which of the following use cases is intended for Data Cloud?

options.explanation: Insights and filtering capabilities within Data Cloud can be used to build smarter audience segments.

question: Which of the following Data Cloud use cases is most applicable when tracking and following a customer's communication preferences?

options.explanation: Consent Management helps deliver communications based on channel-specific consent and customer preference.
This use case focuses on unifying marketing, commerce, and service data to extend marketing abilities.

question: Which of the following ethical best practices refers to limiting your use of data, especially when it comes to demographic, socioeconomic, behavioral, and transactional data?

options.option: Collect and use only what you need.
options.explanation: Limit the use of your data to only what is needed in order to create more personalized experiences for your customers.

options.option: Use and collect individual information appropriately.

options.option: Data Cloud Marketing Admin, Data Cloud Marketing Manager, Data Cloud Marketing Specialist
Data Cloud Admin, Data Cloud Marketing Admin, Data Cloud Data Aware Specialist

question: What categories can a user configure for a data stream?
Which of the following is a valid use of implementing multiple Data Spaces?

options.option: Your data has residency requirements, and you need to ensure data does not cross regional boundaries.
Your business has multiple brands and users need to work on data only in the context of their brand.
Your goal is to run analytics across multiple brands and unify segmentation.

question: What can be packaged using data kits in Data Cloud?

options.option: Data Streams, Data Models, Calculated Insights

question: A logical partitioning of data within a single Data Cloud Instance
Used to package data streams, model objects and insights. Used to package and redeploy assets
Contains all functionality with Data Cloud. Requires Salesforce administrator role to be able to access Data Cloud Setup.
A data specialist wishes to aggregate data from a data lake object and then split the results into two separate data lake objects. What tool should they use?

options.explanation: A streaming insight will only work on a single record and will be unable to aggregate data.
A calculated insight cannot split the result into two separate data lake objects.
A batch data transform has the ability to perform batch calculations and output the results in multiple objects.

question: A data specialist, from a large retail brand that operates in 80 countries worldwide, wishes to take their customer's country data and derive the region from it. What action should they take?

options.option: Create a data stream with a mapping of the country with its region, and create a relationship with the individual via the country.
options.explanation: This approach is feasible because it does not require multiple if or case statements to account for all 80 countries.

options.option: Use formula fields to automatically classify a country to its region.
options.explanation: This approach isn't feasible since there are 80 countries that must be accounted for in the streaming data transform logic.

options.option: Create a streaming data transform to automatically calculate the region of the country when the data is ingested.

question: Which of the following attributes are valid to map to party identification as a unique identifier?

options.explanation: While an order number may be unique, it does not uniquely identify a person.
While birthdate can help identify a person, it is not unique to an individual.
A driver's license number can uniquely identify a person.

question: Which of the following identity resolution functions can be adjusted if the number of unified profiles is much higher than originally anticipated?

options.explanation: Reconciliation rules do not impact how many profiles get unified by identity resolution.
Adjusting match rules can increase or decrease the match rate. For example, to increase match rates, a data specialist may choose to use a fuzzy first name match instead of an exact first name match.
A ruleset creates a brand new set of identity resolution objects and will not impact the existing unified profile.

question: Used when the data corresponds to a list of consumers, businesses, or employees which you intend to segment.
Used when the data is time-series-oriented. When set, an event time field needs to be specified.
Used for any data that does not fit as a profile or engagement, such as product data or store data.
Each one contains its own match and reconciliation rules.
Which of the following serves as the connection between the source data and unified objects?

options.explanation: The Unified Individual object is the output of Identity Resolution on Individuals.
Unified link objects allow you to view source data of each unified profile and are required for creating calculated insights for unified profiles.
Rulesets contain match and reconciliation rules that tell the customer data platform how to link multiple sources of data into a unified profile.

question: Which feature contains match and reconciliation rules that specify how to link multiple sources of data into a unified profile?

options.explanation: Ruleset job processes source profiles according to the map, match, and reconciliation rules you configure to create and update your unified profiles.

Identity resolution consolidates all field values from multiple data sources into unified profiles that can be used in processes such as segmentation and activation, calculated insights, reporting, and more.

question: Which metric is most helpful in determining the cleanliness of your data sources when using Identity Resolution?

options.explanation: The Summary by Source Calculated Insight determines if the number of source records consolidated in identity resolution matches your expectations.
Check the consolidation rate for your ruleset against what you know about how clean your data sources are.
Profile Explorer reviews unified profiles for accurate values.

question: Identity Resolution requires which type of relationship in the data model for Contact Point objects?
Contain match and reconciliation rules
Process source profiles according to map, match, and reconciliation rules

options.explanation: It represents business entities, not individual customer data needed for segment analysis.

It lacks the consolidated insights available through Unified Individual, which are crucial for detailed segment analysis.

question: Which data model object (DMO) is most relevant for analyzing the historical membership of a segment in Salesforce Data Cloud?

options.explanation: It focuses on current membership status, not historical data which tracks changes over time.

options.option: A custom data model object you created for the segment
options.explanation: It may not specifically track historical changes, unlike a predefined DMO designed for this purpose.

question: You want to target a new audience similar to your existing customers who frequently buy camping equipment. Which type of Salesforce Data Cloud segment is best suited for this purpose?

options.explanation: It is typically used for more general segmentation and not specifically for finding lookalikes.
It does not utilize predictive analytics to identify users similar to a current customer base.
It uses machine learning to identify new potential customers who resemble existing customers, suitable for targeting a specific buyer profile.

question: While building a segment on the Data Cloud canvas, you want to filter based on a customer's recent purchase history. What type of attribute is most appropriate to use?

options.explanation: A related attribute allows you to use linked information from different data sources or related tables, ideal for accessing detailed transactional data like recent purchases.
Direct attribute typically refers to attributes directly associated with a primary entity and may not sufficiently capture detailed transaction histories.
In this context, it is used for deriving new data points through calculations rather than directly filtering existing transaction data.

question: Stores that are included in a segment

Links tables based on a data point (for example, customer ID)
Behavioral/engagement data point (for example, purchase)

options.explanation: Data model objects are used for structuring data, not for triggering workflows or case creations.
Webhooks are used for external API integrations, not ideal for internal case management processes.

question: If a customer searches for an "installation manual" after a purchase, how should a company configure Data Cloud to automatically send installation instructions?

options.explanation: Salesforce CRM enrichment is more about enhancing CRM records, not sending direct customer communications.
Marketing Cloud data action targets are designed to send transactional emails based on user actions, fitting for sending installation instructions.
While Flow Builder is powerful, it is not specifically optimized for direct email communications like Marketing Cloud.

question: A company wants to automate a process when data records change in Data Cloud. What should they create in Salesforce to achieve this automation?

options.explanation: Building a flow in Data Cloud automates business processes when a data record changes, aligning with the objective.

Creating a custom object is for storing specific information, not for automating processes directly.

question: A customer's company includes three brands. They have two Salesforce CRM instances, one Salesforce Marketing Cloud account, one Marketing Automation tool, and two mobile applications. How many Data Cloud instances do they need?

You just received a Purchase Order nightly feed that includes these DateTime attributes: Order date, Shipment date, Modified date, File extracted date. What two dates would you use as the EventTime field to ingest data for the engagement category?

options.explanation: A date for an EventTime field should be immutable, meaning it doesn't change. The field you pick also comes down to how you plan to use those dates

question: Suppose you receive the same feed, but order and shipment dates are not available. Instead,Â  you have these fields: Order modified date, File extracted date. What can you use for the EventTime field?

options.option: Create a DateTime field with the timestamp using formula field

options.explanation: None of these fields would be suitable for event time, as the field needs to be immutable and should represent engagement across several dates. Reconnect with the client to get a field that can be used for EventTime.

question: I want to show my service agent a list of unified cases and two calculated insights for a unified individual on the Contact Records in my Service Cloud instance. Which option would you recommend?

options.explanation: There would be no way to activate records from unified individuals to CRM.

options.option: Access unified individuals and their related cases and CI metrics in CRM via LWCs or APIs.
Create a segment of unified individuals with related cases and CI metrics, activate to cloud file storage, and import it back to CRM.
options.explanation: Really? I didn't think having the data in CRM would be the most ideal option.

question: Which of these qualities best describes a Data Cloud Consultant? Select four.

Northern Trail Outfitters uploads new customer data to an Amazon S3 Bucket on a daily basis to be ingested in Data Cloud. In what order should each process be run to ensure that freshly imported data is ready and available to use for any segment?

options.option: Refresh Data Stream > Calculated Insight > Identity Resolution
Identity Resolution > Calculated Insight > Refresh Data Stream

question: Cumulus Financial wants to be able to track the daily transaction volume for of each of its customers in real time and send out a notification as soon it detects volume outside a customer's normal range. How should an administrator accommodate this request?

options.option: Use Streaming Data Transformations with a Flow
Use a Streaming Insight paired with a Data Action
options.explanation: A Streaming Insight is a metric that is calculated on streaming data as it is ingested into Data Cloud, allowing near-real-time analysis of customer behavior. A Data Action is an action that is triggered by a Streaming Insight, such as sending an email, updating a record, or calling an API. By using these features, the administrator can monitor and respond to customer transactions in real time.

options.option: Use Streaming Data Transformations combined with a Data Action
Use a Calculated Insight paired with a Flow

question: A retail customer wants to bring customer data from different sources and wants to take advantage of Identity Resolution so that it can be used in Segmentation. On which entity should this be segmented for activation membership?

options.explanation: The Unified Individual entity represents the result of Identity Resolution, which links together multiple records of an individual from different sources into a single profile4. This entity can be used for Segmentation and Activation, as it provides a complete and accurate view of each customer.
